chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Angela Lee Nelson was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay a fine of $1,500 + costs and surcharges, plus $56.74 for blood testing costs incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office

--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and Agent approval

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without the express written permission of the Agent

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Work-Release privileges; to commence forthwith. 

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process. 

--to comply with DNA sample provision

[MK] case called at 3:50pm 
Defendant Angela Lee Nelson in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance; the victim is present. 
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; Elements are recited; plea of " No Contest " is entered on Count # 1; factual basis is stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3.

On Count # 1 the Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Nelson on Probation for three years, with conditions: 
--to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Work-Release privileges; to commence forthwith. 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and Agent approval
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without the express written permission of the Agent
--to pay a fine of $1,500 + costs and surcharges, plus $56.74 for blood testing costs incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office
--to pay court-appointed attorney fees 
--to pay restitution to Victim 1 in an amount to be determined 
--to comply with DNA sample provision

The Court orders outright (not as conditions of Probation): 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment
--Victim Impact Panel attendance 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Days credit for time already served: 3  days
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
recess 4:16pm 

NEXT:  Restitution Hearing on December 8th at 3:30pm (allow 30 minutes)
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 9:35am 
Defendant Angela Nelson not in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Status of Counsel hearing today.  The Court reviews the written request that Ms. Nelson submitted in which she indicated she does not have transportation to court today. 
The Court authorizes a Warrant but stays its issuance to April 29th at 2:45pm

Letter request from the defendant to reschedule.
Scheduling Order
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions of this Bond include:
-  Maintain absolute sobriety
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  No presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ml] Case called at 1:19PM
Defendant Angela Nelson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond purposes only; eval not yet completed). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att De La Rosa affirms that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits, and preserves all the Defendant's jurisdictional and constitutional objections, and sets this matter for a Status of Counsel hearing.

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
-  Maintain absolute sobriety
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  No presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:25PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 04/19 at 9:30AM in Branch I
